text:
- NXP has a very broad
technology portfolio,

a lot of different chips in
different technology nodes,

and that asks for a lot
and a lot of compute power.

And when those chips
designed to come together,
we get huge peaks
and huge downturns in terms of

I need lots of storage
and a lot of compute.
Our high performance compute environment,
we built that in AWS.
In India, US, Korea,
and in Europe,

we built such environments
with all our engineers,

10,000 in total can work upon
and collaborate together.
By having this huge compute power,

we are able to simulate our
chip designs more and more.
So the quality of our chips are much
and much better than it used to be.
The real benefit was, first of all,

we have an approved operation,
resilience, and security,

and next to that, our R&D
teams will not limited anymore
by having too less compute capacity.

So now they are able
to meet the timelines,
even if our timelines are pulled in.
By utilizing the AWS technology

and services, we as NXP
are more predictable

in designing our products
at a higher quality level.
(gentle music)
